page.title: 11PLANT LIFE NEAR STUBHANPTON
page.content: The chalk downlands have a good representation of flowering plants characteristic of calcareous turf.They include salad burnet,wild thyme,rockrose,harebell,birds-foot trefoil and several varieties of orchids,including the bee orchid. Woodland and neutral grassland varieties of wild flowers are also prevalent in the area. There are few flowerless plant varieties on the downland,only a few mosses and lichens.The most conspicuous mosses are feather mosses. Species of grass are the dominant feature of the area and it is common to find a number of different species all growing together.Typical grasses are:-quaking grass,tor grass, upright brome,meadow oat grass and some of the fescues.
